nodes.text: NaJedha was an oceanic crystalline planet in the galaxy's Mid Rim, orbited by the moon Jedha. The Rebel Alliance were briefly stationed on NaJedha during a mission to contact the Partisans.
Located in the Jedha system, within the Freestanding subsectors of the Mid Rim's Terrabe sector, NaJedha was orbited by the desert moon of Jedha.

Pink oceans were present on the planet's surface, with crystalline formations jutting out from the waves. Some of the formations were topped with solid, flat rock, and were large enough to land a starship on. The formations also housed caves where structures could be built. Jedha's destruction caused dust and fiery rocks to rain down onto NaJedha.

When Leia Organa of the Rebel Alliance wished to ally with the Partisans on Jedha, she and her team set up a base in a cave on NaJedha. After rescuing the Partisan Ubin Des, along with Chulco Gi, Organa returned to NaJedha with Luke Skywalker and Han Solo, where they were greeted by the droids C-3PO and R2-D2. Organa briefly spoke with Des, before returning to find the Partisans on Jedha.
After successfully destroying the Continent-class crawler Leviathan, which had been deployed to mine Jedha, the rebels landed back on NaJedha with Benthic and several members of the Partisans.

NaJedha was first mentioned in the 2016 reference book Star Wars: Rogue One: The Ultimate Visual Guide, written by Pablo Hidalgo. It later appeared in the canon comic Star Wars 38, written by Kieron Gillen, penciled by Salvador Larroca, and published on November 8, 2017.
